title: Business Live: Wednesday 30 October
text:
Nurphoto Copyright: Nurphoto

Maike Currie, director at Fidelity International, says a general election and the possibility of clarity about Brexit can only be good for the UK economy.

She tells BBC Radio Five Live's Wake up to Money: "The key thing is consumer confidence... and business confidence, these two things.

"The UK economy is run by consumers spending money - people have been acting as thought the economy is already in recession. The election is an opportunity to get uncertainty out of the way.

"People can then start making decisions around things like house purchases, we are in a limbo which is not good for personal finances."
description: All the latest breaking business news as it happens.
